name: The Pillar and Post Inn, Spa and Conference Centre

reviews.title: Great place!
reviews.text: I was very pleased about the service. very unusual for North America/ Canada, the staff is very well trained and some of them visited international hospitality schools for example in switzerland ( usually you find student to serve you)

reviews.title: Pugly says Thank you!
reviews.text: I did a site inspection and i visited 15 (!!) rooms, from the standard room to the Elisabeth Suite.

reviews.title: Return visit
reviews.text: I made a last minute trip to NOTL a few weeks ago. Because of the spur of the moment nature of the visit, and the general dearth of hotel rooms, I paid more than I wanted to for a standard room. The rates are outrageous. Let me get that out of the way first off. However, the rates for almost all NOTL accommodations are outrageous.

The first time I stayed at the Pillar and Post, I had one of the nicer rooms with the fireplace and seating area. This time I got a standard room. The staff were a great deal more competent than they have been on previous visits. The room itself was a lot nicer than I was expecting. Nice linens. Everything was comfortable, spotless, and many grades up from what a 2 or 3 star hotel would have had. The small touches like the complimentary box of jams and the rose for the turn-down service were unexpected and welcome too.
reviews.title: Very disappointing
Best Room I've ever stayed in
reviews.text: My room at the Pillar & Post was the nicest room I have ever stayed in. The big beautiful bed with great bedding and fireplace were to die for. Service was excellent as well. I would highly recommend this as a comfortable place to get away.

We stayed at the Pillar and Post Inn during the 2006 Niagara Icewine Festival, and were very pleased. For 130.00 CDN a night, we stayed in a traditional king bed room and received complimentary breakfast the next morning. The room was on the small side, but pretty, clean, and ample windows to let the sun in (including the bathroom). The bed could have been more comfortable. Turndown service included a rose on the pillow, which was a nice touch.
reviews.title: A great value at the right time of year
The absolute worst
reviews.text: We ate at the restaurant, Carriages and Cannery, twice... once for dinner, and once for Sunday brunch, which we upgraded to for an extra 15.00 CDN. Both meals were pricey, but the food was excellent and the service was impeccable. In fact, the customer service throughout the whole weekend was incredible, the best I've ever experienced for such a low price.
I would definitely stay here again, however, I would only go in the off-season, since the prices get exhorbitant in the summer and I don't think the room we stayed in would be worth $400 a night.
reviews.title: Perfect as always!
Restaurant...below average at best
reviews.text: This grossly overpriced dump has small, dank, dark, dirty rooms, and a rude, (especially the waitress by the pool) staff. While NOTL is a lovely town with many fine restaurants, great vineyards, and a nice park by the lake, this place is the Bates motel in town.

description: The Pillar and Post Inn, Spa and Conference Centre's original structure was built in the late 1890's as a canning factory, and since has been lovingly transformed into a charming country inn. With its relaxed elegance, modern amenities, indoor and outdoor pools, and exotic hot springs pool at 100 Fountain Spa, #1 spa in North America (Spas of America 2007-8), Pillar and Post is an ideal setting for a spa getaway, wedding, conference, or family vacation.
